title: Authors and Citation
text: Xu M (2023). inferCSN: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network. R package version 0.1.0, https://mengxu98.github.io/inferCSN/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {inferCSN: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network},   author = {Meng Xu},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://mengxu98.github.io/inferCSN/}, }

title: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("mengxu98/inferCSN")

title: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network
code: git clone https://github.com/mengxu98/inferCSN.git cd inferCSN sh scripts/requirements.sh sudo R CMD INSTALL . # Some packages may prompt not available, please install.

what: Switch weight data table to weight matrix — DT2Matrix
title: Switch weight data table to weight matrix — DT2Matrix
text: Switch weight data table weight matrix

code: DT2Matrix(weightDT = NULL)

title: Switch weight data table to weight matrix — DT2Matrix
Switch weight data table to weight matrix — DT2Matrix
AUC value calculate — auc.calculate
code: auc.calculate(   weightDT = NULL,   groundTruth = NULL,   plot = FALSE,   fileSave = NULL,   interaction = FALSE )

title: AUC value calculate — auc.calculate
text: weightDT weight data table network. groundTruth Ground truth calculate AUC. plot true, draw print figure AUC. fileSave figure name interaction true, consider positivity negativity interaction.

title: AUC value calculate — auc.calculate
code: data("exampleMatrix") data("exampleGroundTruth") weightDT <- inferCSN(exampleMatrix, cores = 1, verbose = TRUE, algorithm = "CDPSI") #> Using L0 penalty...... auc <- auc.calculate(weightDT, exampleGroundTruth, plot = TRUE)  head(auc) #>   AUROC AUPRC #> 1 0.956 0.433

what: Extracts a specific solution in the regularization path. — coef.inferCSN
title: Extracts a specific solution in the regularization path. — coef.inferCSN
Extracts a specific solution in the regularization path. — coef.inferCSN
code: # S3 method for inferCSN coef(object, lambda = NULL, gamma = NULL, supportSize = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for inferCSNCV coef(object, lambda = NULL, gamma = NULL, ...)

title: Extracts a specific solution in the regularization path. — coef.inferCSN
text: object output inferCSN.fit inferCSN.cvfit lambda value lambda extract solution. gamma value gamma extract solution. supportSize number non-zeros solution extracted contain ... ignore

what: Compute and rank TFs in network — compute.gene.rank
title: Compute and rank TFs in network — compute.gene.rank
Compute and rank TFs in network — compute.gene.rank
code: compute.gene.rank(weightDT, directedGraph = FALSE)

title: Compute and rank TFs in network — compute.gene.rank
text: weightDT weight data table network. directedGraph GRN directed

title: Compute and rank TFs in network — compute.gene.rank
Compute and rank TFs in network — compute.gene.rank
code: data("exampleMatrix") weightDT <- inferCSN(exampleMatrix) ranks <- compute.gene.rank(weightDT) head(ranks) #>     gene   pageRank isRegulator #> g17  g17 0.07003499        TRUE #> g4    g4 0.06275100        TRUE #> g7    g7 0.05890882        TRUE #> g14  g14 0.05887013        TRUE #> g11  g11 0.05872313        TRUE #> g9    g9 0.05788238        TRUE

title: Plot of dynamic networks — dynamic.networks
code: dynamic.networks(weightDT, regulators = NULL, legend.position = "right")

title: Plot of dynamic networks — dynamic.networks
text: weightDT weightDT regulators regulators legend.position legend.position

title: Plot of dynamic networks — dynamic.networks
code: data("exampleMatrix") weightDT <- inferCSN(exampleMatrix) ranks <- compute.gene.rank(weightDT) p <- dynamic.networks(weightDT, ranks[1, 1]) p

what: Computes a regularization path and performs K-fold cross-validation — inferCSN.cvfit
title: Computes a regularization path and performs K-fold cross-validation — inferCSN.cvfit
text: Computes regularization path performs K-fold cross-validation

title: Computes a regularization path and performs K-fold cross-validation — inferCSN.cvfit
code: inferCSN.cvfit(   x,   y,   loss = "SquaredError",   penalty = "L0",   algorithm = "CD",   maxSuppSize = 100,   nLambda = 100,   nGamma = 10,   gammaMax = 10,   gammaMin = 1e-04,   partialSort = TRUE,   maxIters = 200,   rtol = 1e-06,   atol = 1e-09,   activeSet = TRUE,   activeSetNum = 3,   maxSwaps = 100,   scaleDownFactor = 0.8,   screenSize = 1000,   autoLambda = NULL,   lambdaGrid = list(),   nFolds = 10,   seed = 1,   excludeFirstK = 0,   intercept = TRUE,   lows = -Inf,   highs = Inf )

title: Computes a regularization path and performs K-fold cross-validation — inferCSN.cvfit
text: x data matrix y response vector loss loss function. Currently support choices "SquaredError" (regression), "Logistic" (logistic regression), "SquaredHinge" (smooth SVM). penalty type regularization. algorithm type algorithm used minimize objective function. maxSuppSize maximum support size terminate regularization path. Recommend setting small fraction min(n,p) (e.g. 0.05 * min(n,p)) L0 regularization typically selects small portion non-zeros nLambda number Lambda values select nGamma number Gamma values select gammaMax maximum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. gammaMin minimum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. partialSort TRUE partial sorting used sorting coordinates greedy cycling. Otherwise, full sorting used. maxIters maximum number iterations (full cycles) CD per grid point. rtol relative tolerance decides terminate optimization (based relative change objective iterations). atol absolute tolerance decides terminate optimization (based absolute L2 norm residuals). activeSet TRUE, performs active set updates. activeSetNum number consecutive times support appear declaring support stabilization. maxSwaps maximum number swaps used CDPSI grid point. scaleDownFactor parameter decides close selected Lambda values . screenSize number coordinates cycle performing initial correlation screening. autoLambda Ignored parameter. Kept backwards compatibility. lambdaGrid grid Lambda values use computing regularization path. nFolds number folds cross-validation. seed seed used randomly shuffling data cross-validation excludeFirstK parameter takes non-negative integers. intercept FALSE, intercept term included model. lows Lower bounds coefficients. highs Upper bounds coefficients.

title: Computes a regularization path and performs K-fold cross-validation — inferCSN.cvfit
text: S3 object type "inferCSNCV" describing regularization path

what: Fit a sparse regression model — inferCSN.fit
title: Fit a sparse regression model — inferCSN.fit
text: Computes regularization path specified loss function penalty function

title: Fit a sparse regression model — inferCSN.fit
code: inferCSN.fit(   x,   y,   loss = "SquaredError",   penalty = "L0",   algorithm = "CD",   maxSuppSize = 100,   nLambda = 100,   nGamma = 5,   gammaMax = 10,   gammaMin = 1e-04,   partialSort = TRUE,   maxIters = 200,   rtol = 1e-06,   atol = 1e-09,   activeSet = TRUE,   activeSetNum = 3,   maxSwaps = 100,   scaleDownFactor = 0.8,   screenSize = 1000,   autoLambda = NULL,   lambdaGrid = list(),   excludeFirstK = 0,   intercept = TRUE,   lows = -Inf,   highs = Inf )

title: Fit a sparse regression model — inferCSN.fit
text: x data matrix y response vector loss loss function. Currently support choices "SquaredError" (regression), "Logistic" (logistic regression), "SquaredHinge" (smooth SVM). penalty type regularization. algorithm type algorithm used minimize objective function. maxSuppSize maximum support size terminate regularization path. Recommend setting small fraction min(n,p) (e.g. 0.05 * min(n,p)) L0 regularization typically selects small portion non-zeros nLambda number Lambda values select nGamma number Gamma values select gammaMax maximum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. gammaMin minimum value Gamma using L0L2 penalty. partialSort TRUE partial sorting used sorting coordinates greedy cycling. Otherwise, full sorting used. maxIters maximum number iterations (full cycles) CD per grid point. rtol relative tolerance decides terminate optimization (based relative change objective iterations). atol absolute tolerance decides terminate optimization (based absolute L2 norm residuals). activeSet TRUE, performs active set updates. activeSetNum number consecutive times support appear declaring support stabilization. maxSwaps maximum number swaps used CDPSI grid point. scaleDownFactor parameter decides close selected Lambda values . screenSize number coordinates cycle performing initial correlation screening. autoLambda Ignored parameter. Kept backwards compatibility. lambdaGrid grid Lambda values use computing regularization path. excludeFirstK parameter takes non-negative integers. intercept FALSE, intercept term included model. lows Lower bounds coefficients. highs Upper bounds coefficients.

title: Fit a sparse regression model — inferCSN.fit
text: S3 object type "inferCSN" describing regularization path

what: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
title: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
code: inferCSN(   matrix = NULL,   penalty = NULL,   algorithm = NULL,   crossValidation = FALSE,   nFolds = 10,   regulators = NULL,   targets = NULL,   maxSuppSize = NULL,   verbose = FALSE,   cores = 1 )

title: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
text: matrix expression matrix, cells genes. penalty [Default = "L0"] type regularization. can take either one following choices: "L0""L0L2". high-dimensional sparse data, single-cell transcriptome data, "L0L2" effective. algorithm [Default = "CD"] Currently "CD" "CDPSI" supported. CDPSI algorithm may yield better results, also increases running time. crossValidation [Default = FALSE] Check whether cross validation used. nFolds [Default = 10] number folds cross-validation. regulators [Default = NULL] Regulator genes. targets [Default = NULL] Target genes. maxSuppSize [Default = NULL] number non-zore coef, value affect final performance. verbose [Default = FALSE] Print detailed information. cores [Default = 1] CPU cores.

title: Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
Inferring cell-specific gene regulatory network — inferCSN
code: data("exampleMatrix") weightDT <- inferCSN(exampleMatrix, verbose = TRUE) #> Using L0 penalty...... head(weightDT) #>     regulator target     weight #> 162       g17    g18  0.6777506 #> 145       g18    g17  0.5707733 #> 127       g17    g16  0.4664720 #> 9         g18     g1 -0.4652000 #> 291       g10     g9  0.4565135 #> 55        g13    g12  0.4553549

title: Format weight table — net.format
code: net.format(weightDT, regulators = NULL)

title: Format weight table — net.format
text: weightDT weight data table network. regulators Regulators list.

title: The heatmap of network — network.heatmap
code: network.heatmap(   weightDT = NULL,   heatmapSize = NULL,   heatmapTitle = NULL,   heatmapColor = NULL,   showNames = FALSE )

title: The heatmap of network — network.heatmap
text: weightDT weight data table network. heatmapSize heatmapSize heatmapTitle heatmapTitle heatmapColor heatmapColor showNames showNames

title: The heatmap of network — network.heatmap
code: data("exampleMatrix") data("exampleGroundTruth") weightDT <- inferCSN(exampleMatrix) p1 <- network.heatmap(exampleGroundTruth,                       heatmapTitle = "Ground truth") p1  p2 <- network.heatmap(weightDT,                       heatmapTitle = "inferCSN") p2  p3 <- network.heatmap(weightDT,                       heatmapTitle = "inferCSN",                       heatmapColor = c("#20a485", "#410054", "#fee81f")) p3  p4 <- network.heatmap(weightDT,                       heatmapTitle = "inferCSN",                       heatmapColor = c("#20a485", "white", "#fee81f")) p4  p5 <- network.heatmap(weightDT,                       heatmapTitle = "inferCSN",                       showNames = TRUE) p5

Sparse regression model — sparse.regression

title: Sparse regression model — sparse.regression
text: X data matrix y response vector crossValidation [Default = FALSE] Check whether cross validation used. penalty [Default = "L0"] type regularization. can take either one following choices: "L0""L0L2". high-dimensional sparse data, single-cell transcriptome data, "L0L2" effective. algorithm [Default = "CD"] Currently "CD" "CDPSI" supported. CDPSI algorithm may yield better results, also increases running time. maxSuppSize [Default = NULL] number non-zore coef, value affect final performance. nFolds [Default = 10] number folds cross-validation. verbose [Default = FALSE] Print detailed information.

CDPSI algorithm may yield better results, also increases running time. maxSuppSize [Default = NULL] number non-zore coef, value affect final performance. nFolds [Default = 10] number folds cross-validation. verbose [Default = FALSE] Print detailed information.
